title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1803.3 - Transfer of projects
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1803.3 - Transfer of projects

State Regulations
(a) When
the State has issued a capital grant to a municipality and the project is to be
transferred to a Municipal Urban Renewal Agency, the following shall be
submitted in duplicate (originals or certified copies): (1)
A novation agreement among HUD, the
municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency, and
(2)
A novation agreement among the State, the
municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency, and
(3)
A cooperation agreement between the
municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency. Where a State capital
grant has been issued to a municipality the cooperation agreement shall recite
that a novation agreement among the State, the municipality and Municipal Urban

Renewal Agency, has been entered into. (4)

Two copies of the loan and grant contract
entered into between HUD and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency. (5)
A resolution of the governing body
approving the novation agreement among the State, the municipality and the

Municipal Urban Renewal Agency and authorizing execution thereof by a specified
municipal official. (6)
A
resolution of the governing body approving the cooperation agreement between
the municipality and Municipal Urban Renewal Agency and authorizing the
execution thereof by a specified municipal official. (7)
A resolution of the Municipal Urban

Renewal Agency authorizing execution of the novation agreement among the State, the municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency by a specified
official. (8)
A resolution of the

Municipal Urban Renewal Agency authorizing execution of the cooperation
agreement between the municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency by a
specified official. (9)

Evidence of
transfer of all project assets from the municipality to the Municipal Urban

Renewal Agency. (b) When
the State has issued a capital grant contract to a Municipal Urban Renewal

Agency and the project is to be transferred to the municipality, the following
shall be submitted in duplicate (originals or certified copies): (1)
A novation agreement among HUD, the
municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency, and
(2)
A novation agreement among the State, the
municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency, and
(3)

Two copies of the grant contract entered
into between HUD and the municipality. (4)
A resolution of the governing body
approving the novation agreement and authorizing the execution thereof by a
specified municipal official. (5)
A
resolution of the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency authorizing execution of the
novation agreement by a specified official. (6)
A financial statement audited by HUD, when a federal grant contract has been issued, and audited by the commissioner, when a State grant contract has been issued, showing: (i) funds received by the agency
(ii)
expenditures made
(iii)
obligations outstanding
(iv)
contracts for financial assistance which
are still in effect. (7)

Evidence of transfer of all project assets from the Municipal Urban Renewal

Agency to the municipality. (c) When the State has issued a capital grant
contract to a municipality for a non-federally assisted project, and the
project is to be transferred to the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency, the
following shall be submitted in duplicate (originals or certified copies): (1)
A novation agreement among the State, the
municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency. (2)
A cooperation agreement between the
municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency which should recite that a
novation agreement among the State, municipality and Municipal Urban Renewal

Agency has been entered into. (3)
A
resolution of the governing body approving the novation agreement among the

State, the municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency and authorizing
execution thereof by a specified municipal official. (4)
A resolution of the Municipal Urban

Renewal Agency authorizing execution by a specified official of the novation
agreement among the State, the municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal

Agency. (5)
A resolution by the
governing body of the municipality approving the cooperation agreement between
the municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency and authorizing
execution thereof by a specified municipal official. (6)
A resolution of the Municipal Urban

Renewal Agency authorizing execution by a specified official of the cooperation
agreement between the municipality and the Municipal Urban Renewal

Agency. (7)

Evidence of transfer of
all project assets from the municipality to the Municipal Urban Renewal

Agency. (d) When the

State has issued a capital grant contract for a non-federally assisted urban
renewal project to the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency and the project is to be
transferred to the municipality, the following shall be submitted in duplicate
(originals or certified copies): (1)
A
novation agreement among the State, the municipality and the Municipal Urban

Renewal Agency. (2)
A resolution of
the governing body approving the novation agreement and authorizing execution
thereof by a specified municipal official. (3)
A resolution of the Municipal Urban

Renewal Agency authorizing the execution thereof by a specified
official. (4)

Evidence of transfer
of all project assets from the Municipal Urban Renewal Agency to the
municipality. (e) After
the transf of project assets, (1)

Opinion of
agency counsel that the project assets have been properly transferred and
delivered, and the documents effecting such transfer are valid and binding in
all respects in accordance with the terms, and are legally
enforceable. (2)

Copies of the
executed documents effecting such transfer of project assets, showing date and
place where recorded, of instruments showing transfer of project real
property. Notes
